metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2183 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The DES and Triple DES ciphers, as used in the TLS, SSH, and IPSecprotocols and other protocols and products, have a birthday bound ofapproximately four billion blocks, which makes it easier for remoteattackers to obtain cleartext data via a birthday attack against along-duration encrypted session, as demonstrated by an HTTPS session usingTriple DES in CBC mode, aka a "Sweet32" attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-demo - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-jre - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
openjdk-7-source - 7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.20').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u121-2.6.8-1ubuntu0.14.04.3').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b41-1.13.13-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
